item.title: Contact Us
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This shows how you can embed a map and contact form using shortcodes. If you have multiple locations, you may want to use the Locations feature (see sidebar). Otherwise, you can simply show your service times, location, phone number, etc. here.

Google Map Shortcode

This map is shown using a shortcode. Refer to the documentation for usage.
[google_map latitude="33.663960772925115"  longitude="-117.64387607574463" type="roadmap" zoom="14" border="yes" height_percent="40"]

Contact Form Shortcode

This form is shown using a shortcode. You can enable reCAPTCHA spam protection for this form in the Theme Options. [contact_form]

item.title: In Principio Creavit Deus Caelum Et Terram
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In principio creavit Deus caelum et terram. Propterea sicut per unum hominem in hunc mundum peccatum intravit et per peccatum mors et ita in omnes homines mors pertransiit in quo omnes peccaverunt. Sic enim dilexit Deus mundum ut Filium suum unigenitum daret ut omnis qui credit in eum non pereat sed habeat vitam aeternam. [caption id="attachment_877" align="alignright" width="300"] Sample image with caption[/caption]

Image with Caption

Let's imagine this post's text wrapped around an image with a caption. Omnis enim quicumque invocaverit nomen Domini salvus erit. In principio creavit Deus caelum et terram. Omnes enim peccaverunt et egent gloriam Dei. In principio creavit Deus caelum et terram. Omnis enim quicumque invocaverit nomen Domini salvus erit. Sic enim dilexit Deus mundum ut Filium suum unigenitum daret ut omnis qui credit in eum non pereat sed habeat vitam aeternam. Omnis enim quicumque invocaverit nomen Domini salvus erit. Et ait faciamus hominem ad imaginem et similitudinem nostram et praesit piscibus maris et volatilibus caeli et bestiis universaeque terrae omnique reptili quod movetur in terra. In principio creavit Deus caelum et terram. Omnis enim quicumque invocaverit nomen Domini salvus erit.

Quotes

The quote shortcode is handy when you want more than a basic blockquote offers. You can set a name, choose to float the quote to the left or right (pullquote), specify a width (one-third, one-half, two-thirds) and decide whether or not the text should be centered.
